# Canadian Fuel Prices Survey 
## Overview

The Department of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) intends to award a contract for a Canadian Fuel Prices Survey. The successful contractor will be responsible for conducting surveys of petroleum product prices from cities across Canada and its territories.

## Scope of Work 

The scope of work includes:

* Conducting daily surveys of individual retailers to calculate the average price of petroleum products in major centres across Canada
* Collecting a minimum of 5 samples per centre from all types of marketers (major retailers, regional retailers, and independent retailers)
* Maintaining a consistent sampling methodology to ensure accurate representation of individual markets
* Conducting daily surveys (Monday to Friday) of wholesale and retail gasoline and diesel products
* Posting the collected data on NRCan's fuel transportation prices webpage by 3:00 pm EST/EDT on the same day
* Calculating monthly averages for each centre, excluding data from weekends and holidays
* Calculating monthly wholesale averages by city using the average of the wholesale prices collected over the month

## Eligibility and Selection Criteria 

Eligible contractors must demonstrate their ability to conduct accurate and timely surveys of petroleum product prices. The selection criteria include:

* Variations or combinations of the above methods
* Experience in conducting similar surveys
* Ability to maintain a consistent sampling methodology
* Capacity to meet the deadlines and deliver the required data

## Trade Agreements 

The contract is subject to various trade agreements, including the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and Canada-EU Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

## Contract Award 

The contract is expected to commence on July 1, 2023, and end on June 30, 2024.
